RCR.Settings.EnableFlanking.Name: Enable Flanking
RCR.Settings.EnableFlanking.Hint: Melee attackers adjacent with an ally on the opposite side get flanking.
RCR.Settings.flankingBehaviour.Name: Flanking Behaviour
RCR.Settings.flankingBehaviour.Hint: Choose how flanking behaves either advtange or modifier
RCR.Settings.FlankingRequiresActive.Name: Flanking Requires Active Ally
RCR.Settings.FlankingRequiresActive.Hint: The flanking ally must not be dead, prone, incapacitated, unconscious, petrified, stunned, or paralyzed.
RCR.Settings.EnableSurrounded.Name: Enable Surrounded
RCR.Settings.EnableSurrounded.Hint: Melee attackers gain advantage when all 4 cardinal sides of the target are blocked by enemies or walls.
RCR.Settings.EnableHighGround.Name: Enable High Ground
RCR.Settings.EnableHighGround.Hint: Ranged weapon and spell attacks get +2 when the attacker is at least 10 ft higher in elevation than the target.
RCR.Settings.EnableConditionAdvantage.Hi: Automatically apply advantage or disadvantage from conditions (e.g. blinded, restrained, prone, invisible, poisoned, paralyzed, stunned, unconscious).
RCR.Note.Flanking.Label: Flanking
RCR.Note.Flanking.DescAdv: An ally is on the opposite side — attack has advantage.
RCR.Note.Flanking.Desc1: An ally is on the opposite side — +1 bonus to the attack roll.
RCR.Note.Flanking.Desc2: An ally is on the opposite side — +2 bonus to the attack roll.
RCR.Note.Flanking.Desc3: An ally is on the opposite side — +3 bonus to the attack roll.
RCR.Note.Flanking.Desc4: An ally is on the opposite side — +4 bonus to the attack roll.
RCR.Note.Flanking.Desc5: An ally is on the opposite side — +5 bonus to the attack roll.
RCR.Note.Surrounded.Label: Surrounded
RCR.Note.Surrounded.Desc: All cardinal sides are blocked — attack has advantage.
RCR.Note.HighGround.Label: High Ground
RCR.Note.HighGround.Desc: Attacker is 10+ ft above the target — +2 bonus to the attack roll.
RCR.Reason.TargetProneMelee: Target is prone — melee has advantage.
RCR.Reason.TargetProneRanged: Target is prone — ranged has disadvantage.
